metadata.Title: CVE-2018-8103 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
The JBIG2Stream::readGenericBitmap function in JBIG2Stream.cc in xpdf 4.00 allows attackers to launch denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via a specific pdf file, as demonstrated by pdftohtml.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-8103` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler58 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
poppler-utils - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> can't reproduce with poppler

criterions.comment: ipe package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
poppler package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6').
xpdf package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
